name: State_2

timeline_beats.label: Formal entry into Maritime Trading League
Signing of Open-Seas Treaty; integration into Sea Trade Union

factions.label: Grand Merchants' Gild
factions.influence_hint: dominant urban trade, controls customs and major credit

factions.label: Admiral Clans
factions.influence_hint: command navy and port militias; regional military sway

factions.label: Tide-Sorcerers' Lodge
factions.influence_hint: provides navigational auguries; gatekeepers of ritual reagents

factions.label: Shipwrights' Consortium
factions.influence_hint: controls shipbuilding yards and industrial labor

factions.label: Coastal Council
factions.influence_hint: city-oligarchy managing laws, ports, and succession settlements

traits: ritual auguries woven into navigation and commerce

constraints: tech baseline: near-medieval to early-industrial; no high-pressure steam megatechs
ritual magic requires scarce imported reagents or specialized local labor
no instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
long-range mind-influence rare and institutionally banned
navigational auguries supplement but cannot replace charts and seamanship
combustion-derived industry limited; heavy industry constrained by material/energy limits
notes: Succession Crisis (W4) left naval command contested; ongoing factional negotiations
Ports depend on steady reagent imports for tide-auguries; supply disruptions destabilize navigation and trade
Guild privileges shape legal and tariff regimes; Merchant Gild sets de facto trade policy
Coastal erosion and reef changes are operational risks for shipping lanes
